intro: Galium hypotrichium subsp. utahense, commonly known as Utah bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer. Its flowering stems are often branched and bear small, oval-shaped fruits. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and forest understories.
